Description: Plaque from a foundation deposit: a thin, opaque red glass plaque turned green inscribed in black ink on one side in hieroglyphic script and on the reverse in Greek. Assembled from two pieces.
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Temple of Aphrodite Urania (Qis), foundation deposit
Curator's comments: Bibliography: 'Zeitschrift für Ägyptische Sprache und Ältertumskunde' 90 (Leipzig and Berlin, 1963), 16ff.; 'British Museum Quarterly' 24 (London, 1961), 35-6; 'Journal of Egyptian Arrchaeology' 48 (London, 1962), 144 (n. 11); 'Journal of Egyptian Arrchaeology' 42 (London, 1956), 97-8, see notes on identical pieces.
Associated names: Named in inscription: Ptolemy IV Philopator
Previous owner: Previous owner/ex-collection: Rev George Denis Nash
